column2: 2. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column10: increase their speed and keep well to the right.

column2: 3. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 4. If you suddenly have no control of the steering wheel, you should:
column4: pump your brake pedal to build pressure.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal. Turn on your emergency flashers and allow your vehicle to come to a slow stop.
column8: react as you would with a blowout.
column10: turn on your emergency flashers and pull off the road.

column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 11. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:

column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 17. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.

column8: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 19. This road sign means the road you're driving on:

column8: turns to the left and then to the right
